entry.title: Act of Sederunt (Sheriff Court Company Insolvency Rules 1986) Amendment (UNCITRAL Model Law on Cross-Border Insolvency) 2006
entry.summary: This Act of Sederunt makes minor amendments to the Sheriff Court Company Insolvency Rules 1986 to make provision in respect of participation in company insolvency cases by foreign administrators under article 12 of the Model Law on Cross-Border Insolvency set out in Schedule 1 to the Cross-Border Insolvency Regulations 2006. It also makes provision for the transfer of insolvency proceedings to the Court of Session where foreign insolvency proceedings have been recognised by that court.

entry.title: The Gambling Act 2005 (Transitional Provisions) Order 2006
entry.summary: This Order makes transitional provision in connection with the commencement of the Gambling Act 2005.

entry.title: Act of Sederunt (Sheriff Court Bankruptcy Rules 1996) Amendment (UNCITRAL Model Law on Cross-Border Insolvency) 2006
entry.summary: This Act of Sederunt makes minor amendments to the Sheriff Court Bankruptcy Rules 1996 to make provision in respect of the initiation of, and participation in bankruptcy cases by foreign administrators under article 11 of the Model Law on Cross-Border Insolvency set out in Schedule 1 to the Cross-Border Insolvency Regulations 2006. It also makes provision for the transfer of bankruptcy proceedings to the Court of Session where foreign insolvency proceedings have been recognised by that court.

entry.title: The Departments (Transfer of Functions) Order (Northern Ireland) 2006
entry.summary: This Order transfers to the Department for Social Development—

entry.title: The Social Security (Persons from Abroad) Amendment Regulations 2006
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Council Tax Benefit Regulations 2006 (S.I. 2006/215), the Council Tax Benefit (Persons who have attained the qualifying age for state pension credit) Regulations 2006 (S.I. 2006/216), the Housing Benefit Regulations 2006 (S.I. 2006/213), the Housing Benefit (Persons who have attained the qualifying age for state pension credit) Regulations 2006 (S.I. 2006/214), the Income Support (General) Regulations 1987 (S.I. 1987/1967), the Jobseeker’s Allowance Regulations 1996 (S.I. 1996/207) and the State Pension Credit Regulations 2002 (S.I. 2002/1792) (“the income-related benefit regulations”). These Regulations also amend the Social Fund Maternity and Funeral Expenses (General) Regulations 2005 (S.I. 2005/3061) (“the social fund regulations”).

entry.title: The Social Security (Persons from Abroad) (Amendment) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2006
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Income Support (General) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 1987, the Housing Benefit (General) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 1987, the Jobseeker’s Allowance Regulations (Northern Ireland) 1996, the State Pension Credit Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2003 (“the income-related benefits regulations”) and the Social Fund Maternity and Funeral Expenses (General) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2005 (“the Social Fund regulations”).

entry.title: The Service Provision Change (Protection of Employment) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2006
entry.summary: These Regulations relate to the treatment of employees, and related matters, in relation to a service provision change, and are made under Article 37(2) of the Employment Relations (Northern Ireland) Order 1999 (“the 1999 Order”).

entry.title: The Cross-Border Insolvency Regulations 2006
entry.summary: On 30th May 1997 the United Nations Commission on International Trade Law (“UNCITRAL”) adopted the text of a model law on cross-border insolvency, which was approved by a resolution of the United Nations General Assembly on 15th December 1997. These Regulations give effect to the model law in Great Britain.

entry.title: The Employment Equality (Age) Regulations 2006
entry.summary: These Regulations, which are made under section 2(2) of the European Communities Act 1972 (c. 68), implement (in Great Britain) Council Directive 2000/78/EC of 27th November 2000 establishing a general framework for equal treatment in employment (O.J. L 303, 2.12.2000, p.16) so far as it relates to discrimination on grounds of age. The Regulations make it unlawful to discriminate on grounds of age in employment and vocational training. They prohibit direct discrimination, indirect discrimination, victimisation, instructions to discriminate and harassment.

entry.title: The Communications Act 2003 (Maximum Penalty for Persistent Misuse of Network or Service) Order 2006

ukm:Supersedes.dc:title: The Communications Act 2003 (Maximum Penalty for Persistent Misuse of Network or Service) Order 2006

entry.summary: This Order amends section 130(4) of the Communications Act 2003 (“the Act”) so as to raise the maximum penalty that the Office of Communications can impose under section 130 of the Act in respect of persistent misuse of electronic communications networks or electronic communications services from £5,000 to £50,000.

entry.title: The Lord Chancellor (Transfer of Functions and Supplementary Provisions) (No.2) Order 2006
entry.summary: This Order transfers, modifies or abolishes certain functions of the Lord Chancellor contained in primary legislation and contained in secondary legislation which is subject to the approval of either or both Houses of Parliament.

entry.title: The Scottish Charity Register (Transitional) Order 2006
entry.summary: This Order makes transitional provisions for the purposes of commencement of section 99 of the Charities and Trustee Investment (Scotland) Act 2005 (“the Act”).

entry.title: The Social Fund (Application for Review) (Amendment) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2006
entry.summary: Regulation 2 of these Regulations amends the Social Fund (Application for Review) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 1988 by providing that an application for review by a social fund inspector may be made to the Office of the Social Fund Inspector or, until 1st April 2007, to an office of the Department for Social Development.

entry.title: The Education (Information as to Provision of Education)(England)(Amendment) Regulations 2006
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Education (Information as to the Provision of Education)(England) Regulations 1999.

entry.title: The Food Protection (Emergency Prohibitions) (Amnesic Shellfish Poisoning) (West Coast) (No. 16) (Scotland) Order 2005 Revocation Order 2006
entry.summary: This version of the The Food Protection (Emergency Prohibitions) (Amnesic Shellfish Poisoning) (West Coast) (No. 16) (Scotland) Order 2005 Revocation Order 2006 is the published under the authority and superintendence of the Queen's Printer for Scotland. It has been prepared to reflect the text as it was Made.

entry.title: The Agriculture (2004 Order) (Commencement and Appointed Day) Order (Northern Ireland) 2006
entry.summary: This Order brings into operation the provisions of the Agriculture (Northern Ireland) Order 2004. (“the 2004 Order”) with the exception of Part I, Article 8 and Schedule 2, Part III, Article 12, Paragraphs 1, 2 and 3 of Schedule 3 and Article 10(2) so far as relating thereto, Article 13 and Schedule 4 so far as relating to the Queen’s University of Belfast Act (Northern Ireland) 1928, and the Horticulture Act (Northern Ireland) 1966 (all of which provisions were brought into operation on the 16th January 2005 by virtue of Article 1(2) of the 2004 Order).

entry.title: The Food Protection (Emergency Prohibitions) (Amnesic Shellfish Poisoning) (West Coast) (No. 8) (Scotland) Order 2005 Revocation Order 2006
entry.summary: This version of the The Food Protection (Emergency Prohibitions) (Amnesic Shellfish Poisoning) (West Coast) (No. 8) (Scotland) Order 2005 Revocation Order 2006 is the published under the authority and superintendence of the Queen's Printer for Scotland. It has been prepared to reflect the text as it was Made.

entry.title: The Management of Offenders etc. (Scotland) Act 2005 (Consequential Modifications) Order 2006
entry.summary: This Order makes provision consequential on the Management of Offenders etc. (Scotland) Act 2005 (asp 14) (“the 2005 Act”).

entry.title: The Films (Definition of "British Film”) Order 2006
entry.summary: This Order modifies the definition of “British film” in Schedule 1 to the Films Act 1985.

entry.title: The Charities and Trustee Investment (Scotland) Act 2005 (Commencement No. 3, Transitional and Savings Provision) Order 2006
entry.summary: This Order is the third commencement order under the Charities and Trustee Investment (Scotland) Act 2005 (“the Act”).
